content:
• Tuesday, November 8, 2011
  • AABA

    Shares of Yahoo (YHOO) spike higher AH on continuing rumors that Softbank (OTCPK:SFTBY) and...

    Shares of Yahoo (YHOO) spike higher AH on continuing rumors that Softbank (OTCPK:SFTBY) and Alibaba (OTC:ALBCF) are talking to PE funds about a potential bid. YHOO +2.9% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:49 PM
  • SVM

    More on Silvercorp (NYSE:SVM): Q3 revenue was slightly below estimates, but up 71% Y/Y on record...

    More on Silvercorp (NYSE:SVM): Q3 revenue was slightly below estimates, but up 71% Y/Y on record cash flow from operations. Gold production jumped seven-fold, primarily a result of added gold production from its newly acquired BYP mine. Shares +1.9% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:39 PM
  • LOW

    Lowe's (NYSE:LOW) pops +2% AH after Pershing Square's Bill Ackman is said to recommend shares of...

    Lowe's (NYSE:LOW) pops +2% AH after Pershing Square's Bill Ackman is said to recommend shares of the home improvement retailer at a Great Investors' Best Ideas conference.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:57 PM
  • POWL

    Powell Industries (NASDAQ:POWL), a maker of electrical control systems for industrial and...

    Powell Industries (NASDAQ:POWL), a maker of electrical control systems for industrial and utility clients, drops 18.1% AH after announcing it will restate its FQ2 and FQ3 results, due to accounting errors at its Canadian operations. Powell says the accounting issues will lower its EPS for the first 3 fiscal quarters of 2011 (ended June 30) by $0.23.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:38 PM
  • ADBE

    More from Adobe (NASDAQ:ADBE): The company says it plans to "reduce its investment, and expected...

    More from Adobe (NASDAQ:ADBE): The company says it plans to "reduce its investment, and expected license revenue," in certain enterprise products. As a result, Adobe expects FY12 revenue growth of 4%-6%, below a 9% consensus. Adobe says it anticipates double-digit revenue growth down the line, but considering that's not happening this year or next, investors are likely skeptical. ADBE -7.3% AH. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:29 PM
  • ADBE

    Adobe (NASDAQ:ADBE) drops 7.6% AH after reaffirming its FQ4 guidance, and announcing it will cut...

    Adobe (NASDAQ:ADBE) drops 7.6% AH after reaffirming its FQ4 guidance, and announcing it will cut 750 jobs (roughly 8% of its workforce). The company also says it plans to "align its business" around its faster-growing Digital Media and Digital Marketing (Omniture) solutions.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:17 PM
  • ROVI

    More on Rovi's (NASDAQ:ROVI) Q3 report: The company has guided on its call for 2011 EPS of...

    More on Rovi's (NASDAQ:ROVI) Q3 report: The company has guided on its call for 2011 EPS of $2.35-$2.60, compared with a $2.53 consensus. This implies Q4 EPS of $0.50-$0.75, compared with a $0.70 consensus. Shares now -19.5% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:59 PM
  • RBCN

    Rubicon Technology (NASDAQ:RBCN): Q3 EPS of $0.35 beats by $0.09. Revenue of $33.6M beats by...

    Rubicon Technology (NASDAQ:RBCN): Q3 EPS of $0.35 beats by $0.09. Revenue of $33.6M beats by $2.4M. Sees Q4 EPS to be in the range of $0.07-$0.10 on revenue between $20M-$23M, below Street estimates for an EPS of $0.26 on revenue $32M. Shares -9.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:57 PM
  • STEC

    More on STEC's Q3 report: The company blames the shortfall on a product transition, as its...

    More on STEC's Q3 report: The company blames the shortfall on a product transition, as its server and storage OEM customers continue qualifications for new products that won't be over until Q2 2012. But many will assume STEC's existing products have lost share at key accounts.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:54 PM
  • STEC

    Solid-state drive maker STEC falls 15.4% AH after posting Q3 results. While revenue of $72.5M...

    Solid-state drive maker STEC falls 15.4% AH after posting Q3 results. While revenue of $72.5M (-16% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.14 beat by $1.8M and $0.04, the company is guiding for Q4 revenue of $55M-$57M and EPS of -$0.02 to breakeven, far below a consensus of $72.6M and $0.11.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:53 PM
  • AOL

    AOL, Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) and Yahoo (YHOO) announce a deal to share access to one another's...

    AOL, Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) and Yahoo (YHOO) announce a deal to share access to one another's premium online ad inventory. By early 2012, the companies' real-time bidding mechanisms will be integrated to allow more reach and scale for premium ads. AH: AOL +2.7%, MSFT -1.3%, YHOO -0.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:43 PM
  • BHC

    More on Medicis Pharmaceutical (MRX): Q3 misses estimates across the board. Revenue grew an...

    More on Medicis Pharmaceutical (MRX): Q3 misses estimates across the board. Revenue grew an anemic 4% Y/Y as the company was hit by higher R&D and promotional costs associated with marketing. Shares -2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM
  • PLAB

    Photronics (NASDAQ:PLAB), a maker of photomasks for chip and flat-panel display manufacturing,...

    Photronics (NASDAQ:PLAB), a maker of photomasks for chip and flat-panel display manufacturing, is warning it expects FQ4 revenue of $120M-$122M and EPS of $0.11-$0.13, below prior guidance of $125M-$130M and $0.14-$0.18. The company blames "increased softness" in the chip and display markets for the shortfall.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:36 PM
  • NILE

    Shares of Blue Nile (NASDAQ:NILE) drop 12% AH after the firms misses EPS estimates with its Q3...

    Shares of Blue Nile (NASDAQ:NILE) drop 12% AH after the firms misses EPS estimates with its Q3 report, steers Q4 and FY11 revenue guidance lower, and announces the resignation of its current CEO.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM
  • ATVI

    More on Activision's Q3: 44% of revenue from online subscriptions (42% in Q2, 33% in year-ago...

    More on Activision's Q3: 44% of revenue from online subscriptions (42% in Q2, 33% in year-ago period). 5% of revenue from handheld devices. Company now expects 2011 revenue of $4.25B and EPS of $0.85, above consensus of $4.11B and $0.79. Says it's seeing "stronger than expected consumer response" to Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3. ATVI +0.9% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM | 1 Comment
  • GRPN

    Unable to take advantage of rallying markets since it came public, Groupon (GRPN -4.1%) closes...

    Unable to take advantage of rallying markets since it came public, Groupon (GRPN -4.1%) closes at $24.90, its low point since shares started trading hands following the $20 IPO.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM
  • EXAR

    Shares of Exar (EXAR -1.9%) finish the day lower after announcing the departure of its CEO....

    Shares of Exar (EXAR -1.9%) finish the day lower after announcing the departure of its CEO. Wunderlich downgraded the shares earlier on the news.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM
  • AMGN

    Amgen (AMGN -0.7%) underperformed a little today after a U.S. appeals court gave a green light...

    Amgen (AMGN -0.7%) underperformed a little today after a U.S. appeals court gave a green light to a securities class-action lawsuit accusing the company of failing to disclose safety information for two anemia drugs, and of promoting unauthorized uses of its products.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM
  • MR

    Chinese medical device firm Mindray Medical (NYSE:MR) rallied from its session lows, but still...

    Chinese medical device firm Mindray Medical (NYSE:MR) rallied from its session lows, but still fell 7% after reporting Q3 results. While revenue of $218.4M (+30% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.36 beat consensus by $20.6M and $0.03, the fact the company merely reaffirmed its 2011 net income guidance isn't going over well. Separately, Mindray announced a $100M stock buyback. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM
  • YPF

    Argentinean oil major YPF (YPF +13.7%) and its parent Repsol (OTCQX:REPYY +7.4%) will finish...

    Argentinean oil major YPF (YPF +13.7%) and its parent Repsol (OTCQX:REPYY +7.4%) will finish with big gains following last night's announcement of a "transformational" oil and gas discovery in Argentina. Other Argentina exploration plays: Americas Petrogas (OTCPK:APEOF +27%), Apache (APA +3.3%).
     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • BKE

    Buckle (BKE -2.5%) gets hit by a downgrade from Stephens to Equal-weight, saying the apparel...

    Buckle (BKE -2.5%) gets hit by a downgrade from Stephens to Equal-weight, saying the apparel chain's discount to its peers "has been erased." It adds that the company faces tougher comps and limited upside to margins going forward. Separately, Susquehanna also cuts its rating on the shares to Neutral.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:55 PM
  • FN

    Fabrinet (FN +5%) shares move higher after FQ1 earnings and revenue rose more than expected, and...

    Fabrinet (FN +5%) shares move higher after FQ1 earnings and revenue rose more than expected, and investors like the company's candor in detailing flood damage to factories in Thailand that damaged its hard-drive manufacturing operations. Fabrinet says it can't yet anticipate net operating results for FQ2, although it anticipates suffering a net loss on declining revenue.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:52 PM

  • K-V Pharmaceutical (KV.A +99.2%) soars in afternoon trading after the FDA states it "does not...

    K-V Pharmaceutical (KV.A +99.2%) soars in afternoon trading after the FDA states it "does not intend to take enforcement action" against pharmacies that compound its  Makena drug for preventing premature births in women who have had a prior premature birth.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:50 PM
  • ASEI

    American Science & Engineering (ASEI -1.6%) drops after Benchmark cuts the shares to Sell on...

    American Science & Engineering (ASEI -1.6%) drops after Benchmark cuts the shares to Sell on valuation, citing lower bookings, and slowing U.S. military demand.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:46 PM
  • OA

    Alliant Techsystems (ATK -1.3%) slips after RBC cut the shares to Market Perform. The firm cites...

    Alliant Techsystems (ATK -1.3%) slips after RBC cut the shares to Market Perform. The firm cites declining defense budgets, weak margins and NASA funding concerns. Separately, SunTrust also lowers its rating to Neutral due to a lack of growth catalysts.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 PM
  • RJETQ

    Shares of Republic Airways (RJET +56%) skyrocket after the company says it's looking to sell or...

    Shares of Republic Airways (RJET +56%) skyrocket after the company says it's looking to sell or spin off Frontier Airlines.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:31 PM | 2 Comments
  • AOBI

    Microcap American Oriental Bioengineering (AOB-8.8%) delays the release of its Q3 results and...

    Microcap American Oriental Bioengineering (AOB-8.8%) delays the release of its Q3 results and earnings conference call without stating a reason. Shares - up on the day before the announcement - are now falling sharply.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:20 PM
  • PAAS

    Minefinders (MFN -8.6%) trades down after its Q3 results missed EPS estimates late yesterday....

    Minefinders (MFN -8.6%) trades down after its Q3 results missed EPS estimates late yesterday. Production for the quarter was hindered by supplier cutbacks of key mining components, as well as shutdowns due to equipment failures. The company expects production to improve in Q4 - having already shipped over 7900 ounces of gold and over 274K ounces of silver in October - and maintains its production guidance for FY11.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:18 PM

  • Crude oil continues its relentless rise, +1.3% to $96.80, the highest level since July. While...

    Crude oil continues its relentless rise, +1.3% to $96.80, the highest level since July. While oil's pop has coincided with the return to risk since early October, bubbling Middle East tensions - with chatter of a unilateral strike on Iran's nuclear facilities by Israel - may be playing a role as well.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:07 PM | 1 Comment
  • EMR

    Emerson Electric (EMR +3%) gets a boost after Citi upgrades the stock to Buy on valuation and...

    Emerson Electric (EMR +3%) gets a boost after Citi upgrades the stock to Buy on valuation and raises its price target to $60. Citi says the company's attractive late-cycle exposure should position it to outgrow peers in a slow growth environment.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:49 PM
  • TDG

    TransDigm Group (TDG +3.5%) acquires privately-held aircraft components manufacturer Harco...

    TransDigm Group (TDG +3.5%) acquires privately-held aircraft components manufacturer Harco Laboratories for approximately $84M in cash. The purchase, subject to review under the Hart-Scott-Rodino Act and other customary closing conditions, is expected to close late in the first quarter of fiscal 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:45 PM
  • DNDN

    Management still seems to have faith in Dendreon (DNDN +11.1%) despite recent setbacks (I, II)...

    Management still seems to have faith in Dendreon (DNDN +11.1%) despite recent setbacks (I, II) related to its Provenge prostate cancer treatment, as shares rally on news that the CFO and a Director just bought 32,530 shares at $6.66-$6.68, worth ~$217K.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:39 PM | 1 Comment
  • BID

    Sotheby's (BID -3.6%) trades down after its Q3 lands wide of the mark. Losses widened Y/Y as the...

    Sotheby's (BID -3.6%) trades down after its Q3 lands wide of the mark. Losses widened Y/Y as the auction house was hit by higher expenses and lower auction commission revenue. Separately, the company raises its quarterly dividend by 60% to $0.08 per share.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:31 PM
  • STX

    Seagate (STX -1.7%), one of this fall's big winners after emerging unscathed from Thai flooding,...

    Seagate (STX -1.7%), one of this fall's big winners after emerging unscathed from Thai flooding, is underperforming following a downbeat column from the WSJ's Rolfe Winkler. While conceding Seagate's near-term profits will soar, Winkler argues the flooding won't halt the steady displacement of hard drives by solid-state drives (SSDs). Indeed, higher hard drive prices could accelerate SSD adoption.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM
  • CE

    Celanese Corp. (CE +1.1%) trades up after naming Albemarle (ALB -1%) head Mark Rohr to replace...

    Celanese Corp. (CE +1.1%) trades up after naming Albemarle (ALB -1%) head Mark Rohr to replace retiring Chairman and CEO David Weidman.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:17 PM
  • JRCCQ

    James River Coal (JRCC -10.3%) gets hit after posting a surprise loss for Q3 despite a surge in...

    James River Coal (JRCC -10.3%) gets hit after posting a surprise loss for Q3 despite a surge in revenue. Profit jumped 77% Y/Y to $303M on increased shipments from its Central Appalachia coal operations, but the gains were largely offset by a 98% jump in its total cost of sales to $288M.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:05 PM
  • BWA

    Automotive component supplier BorgWarner (BWA -5%) is selling off after stating it expects $2.5B...

    Automotive component supplier BorgWarner (BWA -5%) is selling off after stating it expects $2.5B in "net new powertrain business" from 2012 to 2014, an increase of just 9% from the prior 3-year period. However, Morgan Stanley is declaring BorgWarner a "research tactical idea," claiming the company's backlog is stronger than expected, and EPS estimates will rise.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:49 PM
  • FOSL

    Fossil's (FOSL -3.4%) Q3 beat estimates, but the stock dips after the company cuts its Q4...

    Fossil's (FOSL -3.4%) Q3 beat estimates, but the stock dips after the company cuts its Q4 earnings forecast. Revenue was helped by double-digit growth in same-store sales, but rising production costs weakened bottom-line margins. The company now expects Q4 EPS in the range of $1.75 - $1.78, below Street estimates of $1.78 per share.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:34 PM
  • SHOR

    ShoreTel (SHOR +6.4%), a provider of enterprise voice-over-IP hardware and software, has spiked...

    ShoreTel (SHOR +6.4%), a provider of enterprise voice-over-IP hardware and software, has spiked in afternoon trading on news that director Gary J. Daichendt purchased 45,588 shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:32 PM
  • CHSP

    Chesapeake Lodging (CHSP +1.2%) trades higher after Deutsche ups the shares to Buy from Hold on...

    Chesapeake Lodging (CHSP +1.2%) trades higher after Deutsche ups the shares to Buy from Hold on valuation, citing the company's high occupancy rates and high RevPar growth potential.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:19 PM
  • DF

    Dean Foods (DF +3.3%) trades higher ahead of its earnings report after the close, boosted by an...

    Dean Foods (DF +3.3%) trades higher ahead of its earnings report after the close, boosted by an upgrade to Overweight by Stephens on valuation. Stephens says the stock is currently trading at a wider-than-normal discount to the S&P 500, which gives it a favorable risk/reward dynamic.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:02 PM
  • LDL

    Shares of microcap Lydall (LDL -19.5%) plunge after the firm discloses accounting errors that...

    Shares of microcap Lydall (LDL -19.5%) plunge after the firm discloses accounting errors that cut its Q2 earnings by 4 cents a share. The company says the errors were related to the accounting for U.S. income taxes associated with dividends from a foreign subsidiary.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:54 PM
  • TMS

    Industrial services outsourcing firm TMS International (TMS +9.9%) pops after its Q3 handily...

    Industrial services outsourcing firm TMS International (TMS +9.9%) pops after its Q3 handily beats estimates. Revenue jumped 19% Y/Y, despite higher raw material costs. Gross margins dipped to 24.6% compared to 25.9%, due in part to new contracts in start-up mode, increased overhead expenses and higher fuel costs. The company reaffirms guidance for FY11 in the range of $133M - $137M.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM
  • CATM

    Cardtronics (CATM +4.9%) gains after posting a Q3 that beat estimates across the board. Profit...

    Cardtronics (CATM +4.9%) gains after posting a Q3 that beat estimates across the board. Profit more than doubled on strong organic growth from recent acquisitions and its expansion into new markets. The company also raised its full-year guidance, now expecting revenue between $615M - $620M.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:24 PM
  • ALLT

    Allot Communications (ALLT -6.3%) dips after announcing a 5M secondary. The company says the...

    Allot Communications (ALLT -6.3%) dips after announcing a 5M secondary. The company says the proceeds will be used for general corporate purposes, including working capital and potential acquisitions.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:04 PM
  • SNHY

    Sun Hydraulics (SNHY -16.1%) becomes the latest industrial parts supplier to fall after a weak...

    Sun Hydraulics (SNHY -16.1%) becomes the latest industrial parts supplier to fall after a weak earnings report: while Q3 revenue of $53M (+39% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.44 beat consensus by $0.1M and $0.05, the company is guiding for Q4 revenue of $44M and EPS of $0.26-$0.28, below a consensus of $49M and $0.32. The Q4 outlook is attributed to order weakness that Sun claims is reflected in weak PMI readings.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM
  • BCRX

    Shares of BioCryst Pharmaceuticals (BCRX +3.4%) get a lift after the company reveals its BCX4208...

    Shares of BioCryst Pharmaceuticals (BCRX +3.4%) get a lift after the company reveals its BCX4208 gout drug met its primary endpoint in a Phase 2b randomized, double-blind, dose-response study. CEO Jon Stonehouse says the next big step is to find a partner for lead development for the drug that he says has a market potential of $500M.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:54 AM
  • IFF

    International Flavors & Fragrances (IFF -10.8%) takes a hit after its Q3 results missed...

    International Flavors & Fragrances (IFF -10.8%) takes a hit after its Q3 results missed analysts' estimates. Revenue declined as its fragrances business was pressured by price-driven volume declines in its ingredients unit, and a general weakening of its more discretionary categories, such as fine fragrance and beauty care.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:52 AM
  • CVU

    CPI Aerostructures (CVU +16.2%) jumps after its Q3 beats estimates across the board. Revenues...

    CPI Aerostructures (CVU +16.2%) jumps after its Q3 beats estimates across the board. Revenues increased 28% Y/Y, primarily due to contract work done for Boeing (BA -0.5%) on the A-10 attack jet and on the E-2D surveillance airplane for Northrop Grumman (NOC -1%). The company raises its FY12 revenue guidance, now expecting revenues of $95M to $98M, above the Street estimate of $95M.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM
  • THRM

    Amerigon (ARGN), a maker of climate-controlled seats, gains 10.1% after reporting Q3 revenue of...

    Amerigon (ARGN), a maker of climate-controlled seats, gains 10.1% after reporting Q3 revenue of $125.6M (+311% Y/Y thanks to W.E.T. acquisition) and EPS of $0.07; the latter missed by $0.03, but the former beat $10.6M. The company, which expects Q4 revenue to decline Q/Q due to seasonality, also claims a new thermoelectric generator product is being tested in BMW and Ford vehicles.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:26 AM
  • DRYS

    DryShips (DRYS +9.2%) pops after its Q3 beats estimates. Revenue rose 41% Y/Y to $318M, but were...

    DryShips (DRYS +9.2%) pops after its Q3 beats estimates. Revenue rose 41% Y/Y to $318M, but were offset somewhat as vessel and drilling rig operating expenses doubled to $105M. Drybulk fleet utilization also increased to 98.9% from 97.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:04 AM
  • EXPE

    Expedia (EXPE -1.4%) shares slip after Morgan Stanley cuts its rating to Underweight with a...

    Expedia (EXPE -1.4%) shares slip after Morgan Stanley cuts its rating to Underweight with a price target of $25, reflecting "growing concern that Expedia’s hotel business faces increasing competitive headwinds," withs Priceline's (PCLN) Booking.com unit potentially taking share. Expedia’s air and packaging business could remain weak due to rising airfares and weak capacity growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM
  • BWXT

    Babcock & Wilcox (BWC) knocks out a 8.4% gain after reporting Q3 earnings above estimates on...

    Babcock & Wilcox (BWC) knocks out a 8.4% gain after reporting Q3 earnings above estimates on broad segment revenue growth. The Nuclear Energy segment posted a 77% Y/Y revenue jump on higher sales of naval nuclear sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:47 AM
  • CNI

    Canadian National Railway (CNI -1.2%) dips after announcing a a two-tranche debt offering...

    Canadian National Railway (CNI -1.2%) dips after announcing a a two-tranche debt offering totaling $700M. The company plans to use the funds to repay all its outstanding commercial paper and partially finance its share-repurchase program. The offering's expected to close November 15.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 AM
  • VRTX

    Shares of Vertex (VRTX -7.6%) are lower again today as Robert Baird cut the shares to Neutral...

    Shares of Vertex (VRTX -7.6%) are lower again today as Robert Baird cut the shares to Neutral this morning on the news. Baird says the HCV competitive landscape is going to put pressure on Incivek's weekly script trends and weigh on earning growth going forward.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:31 AM
  • SHAW

    Shares of Shaw Group (SHAW -5.4%) fall off after the company announces a $150M cash tender offer...

    Shares of Shaw Group (SHAW -5.4%) fall off after the company announces a $150M cash tender offer - an amount representing close to 9% of the firm's market cap if sold to completion. The firm says the share price on the offer will fall between $22.25 and $25.25.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:31 AM
  • XIDEQ

    Exide Technologies (XIDE -29.3%), a maker of batteries for industrial and automotive...

    Exide Technologies (XIDE -29.3%), a maker of batteries for industrial and automotive applications, freefalls after reporting FQ2 revenue of $773M (+16% Y/Y) and EPS of -$0.05; the former beat by $16.3M, but the latter missed by $0.16. In addition, Exide says it was notified in October of potential accounting fraud at a Portuguese recycling facility, and is investigating the matter.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:13 AM | 1 Comment
  • RJETQ

    Republic Airways (RJET +19.1%) pops after smashing estimates with its Q3 results, boosted by a...

    Republic Airways (RJET +19.1%) pops after smashing estimates with its Q3 results, boosted by a big revenue gain at its Frontier Airlines unit. The company says it has achieved "substantially" all of its restructuring goals for Frontier under a $120M improvement plan.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:04 AM
  • BKS

    Barnes & Noble’s (BKS +4.4%) unveiling of its Nook Tablet computer must be...

    Barnes & Noble’s (BKS +4.4%) unveiling of its Nook Tablet computer must be “instrumental in driving holiday traffic” to the retailer, Barclays' Alan Rifkin writes - critical, he says, because BKS lost $0.99/share in its July FQ1, probably lost $0.08/share last quarter, and will lose another $0.78/share in FQ4, which leaves just the January quarter to make “over 200%” of its profit.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:59 AM | 1 Comment
  • NILE

    Blue Nile (NASDAQ:NILE) moves 6.9% higher after racking up a 2.6% gain yesterday. The strong...

    Blue Nile (NASDAQ:NILE) moves 6.9% higher after racking up a 2.6% gain yesterday. The strong upward push comes in advance of the online jewelry seller's Q3 earnings report slated for today.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM
  • ROK

    Shares of Rockwell Automation (NYSE:ROK) soar 8.3% higher on the open after the firm beats Q3...

    Shares of Rockwell Automation (NYSE:ROK) soar 8.3% higher on the open after the firm beats Q3 estimates for revenue and profits. The 22% Y/Y jump in sales was assisted by a currency translation that contributed 4 percentage points and new acquisitions another point. The company ups its guidance for 2012 EPS to $5.05-$5.45 on revenue projected to fall between $6.2B-$6.5B.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:49 AM
  • LEAF

    Demand Media (DMD +12.3%) remains up sharply following its Q3 beat. Goldman (Neutral) is...

    Demand Media (DMD +12.3%) remains up sharply following its Q3 beat. Goldman (Neutral) is slightly lifting its PT, and is encouraged by the company's improving IRR. However, Henry Blodget isn't impressed, noting Demand Media only turned a profit by treating content costs as a capital investment - something almost no other media company does.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:47 AM
  • TOL

    Upscale homebuilder Toll Brothers (TOL +3.7%) opens higher after preannouncing FQ4 revenue of...

    Upscale homebuilder Toll Brothers (TOL +3.7%) opens higher after preannouncing FQ4 revenue of $427.7M (+6% Y/Y), $10.3M above consensus. The company is also reporting Q4 net signed contracts rose 24% Y/Y to $389.9M, and its year-end backlog rose 15%, to $981.1M.
